title: Excursions

themes.title: UNIQUE GUIDED SERVICE
themes.description:
Accompanying you on an excursion on the island of Naxos represents a moment of sharing, exchange, and communion.
It is about passing on my knowledge and what I am passionate about; promoting human, cultural, and historical values; engaging with traditions; respecting and being attentive to the environment around us, and marveling at everything that is offered to us.
Contact me for any information.

themes.title: RETURN TO THE ROOTS
themes.description:
Let’s leave the capital and head towards the center of the island.
First, let’s stop at the Traditional Pottery workshop in the village of Damalas, and discover a craft passed down from generation to generation.
A few meters from this emblematic place, an old Olive Press takes us back in time, revealing the secrets of oil production from the past.
Let’s continue our journey to the typical village of Chalki.
Observe the Venetian balconies, the flower-lined streets, the artisan shops, and let’s taste the famous Kitron liqueur at the distillery.
Next, we head towards the marble village of Apeiranthos, passing through the village of Filoti at the foot of Mount Zeus, allowing us to admire a magnificent panorama from the heights.
We then bypass the impressive Marble Quarry, before taking a culinary tasting break at a local taverna.
The digestive walk that follows our meal reveals one of the island’s Water Springs, located in the heart of the charming little village of Mili.
Finally, before returning to the port, we visit the Kouros of Flerio, the timeless statue over 3000 years old.
Duration: approximately 7 hours / about 8 people
Included: Transfer / Guide / Meal.
Rates: 
-Adult: 135€/p
 -Child (6~12 years): 60€/p
Contact me to make your reservation and for any additional information.

themes.title: GUIDED WALK AT SUNSET
themes.description:
Let’s stroll through the narrow and lively streets of the old town, leading us to the ancient fortress called the Kastro; a historical site where the homes and religious buildings testify to the island’s identity.
Then, let’s make a quick stop to savor the famous Naxos Kitron liqueur, before heading to the iconic Portara; a remnant of the temple dedicated to Apollo, to watch the sunset and admire the breathtaking view of Chora, its hinterland, and the Aegean Sea.
This magnificent panorama continues from a beautiful terrace overlooking the port, where a tasting of local specialties concludes this visit, blending history and mythology.

cruises.title: The Small Cyclades: Ano / Kato Koufonissi / Rina Cave
cruises.description:
Relaxation, swimming, and exploration are on the agenda for this cruise in the Aegean Sea.
You will head south of Naxos along the East coast.
The first stop allows you to swim inside the Rina Cave and explore the translucent underwater world.

cruises.title: Iraklia / Ano Koufonissi
cruises.description:
This cruise gives you the opportunity to explore, at your own pace, the small port of the wild island of Iraklia.
Visit the island of Ano Koufonissi, its warm village, and the beaches lining crystal-clear waters.

cruises.title: Delos / Mykonos
cruises.description:
A combination that allows you to explore the island of Delos, an open-air museum and UNESCO World Heritage site (3 hours), and wander through the picturesque streets of Mykonos town, where the charming Little Venice and the famous windmills offer breathtaking views (4 hours).
Departure at 9:00 from the marina in Chora. Return at 18:50 in Naxos. (Times may vary +/- 15 min depending on the cruise operator).

cruises.title: Mykonos
cruises.description:
Departure at 9:00 from the marina in Chora, arriving at 10:30 directly at the port in Mykonos town.
Free day. Departure at 17:00, arrival in Naxos at 18:50. (Times may vary +/- 15 min depending on the cruise operator).

cruises.title: Santorini
cruises.description:
Enjoy complete pick-up from your arrival at the port of Santorini, along with a guided tour (English & French). Explore the villages of Oia and Fira perched on the cliffs and take your time to walk while admiring the stunning view of the volcano from the spectacular caldera. (6h30).
Departure at 8:00 from the marina in Chora. Return at 19:50 in Naxos. (Times may vary +/- 15 min depending on the cruise operator).

cruises.title: Paros
cruises.description:
Departure at 9:00 from the marina in Chora, arriving at 9:30 at the small port of the fishing village of Naoussa.
Free day. Departure at 18:10, arrival in Naxos at 18:50. (Times may vary +/- 15 min depending on the cruise operator).
In case of cancellation due to bad weather conditions, the ticket price is fully refundable.

location.title: Transportation Rentals
location.intro: Do you want assistance in renting a vehicle, scooter, or quad, with delivery to the port or to your residence in Naxos?
location.p: Feel free to contact me for any information requests and to make your reservation.

slides.title: Traditional Fishing (6h30):
slides.text: Experience traditional net fishing alongside a professional crew while enjoying a cruise along the coasts of Naxos and the Small Cyclades. Swim while the meal, made from freshly caught fish, is being prepared, which you will then enjoy on board.

slides.title: Saint Anna Vineyard (2h):
slides.text: Visit the vineyard, the St Anna chapel dating from the 9th century, and the estate's cellar where the winemaking process is explained, followed by a tasting of different wines.

slides.title: Kitron Distillery - Promponas (1h/1h30):
slides.text: Visit the site, learn about and discover the different steps of Kitron distillation, this liqueur 'made in Naxos', accompanied by a rich tasting. Master class option on cocktails made with Kitron.

slides.title: Cooking Class (4h):
slides.text: Prepare several typical dishes using local knowledge that you will proudly enjoy after a guided tour of the agricultural lands by the owner.

slides.title: Pottery Class (1h):
slides.text: Shape, mold, and feel... Transform a noble material with your own hands according to local tradition and keep the memory of a unique piece.

slides.title: Marble Sculpting (2h):
slides.text: Listen to a passionate artist tell you the story and art of marble sculpting and create your own masterpiece.
